H0.text: Glucose is the green pigment that allows plants to change the Sun's energy into chemical energy.

H1.text: Chlorophyll is the green pigment that allows plants to convert the Sun's energy into chemical energy.

H2.text: Mitochondria are the green pigment that allows plants to change the Sun's energy into chemical energy.

H3.text: Photosynthesis is the green pigment that allows plants to change the Sun's energy into chemical energy.

A4.text: Chlorophyll is any of several related green pigments found in cyanobacteria and in the chloroplasts of algae and plants.

A5.text: The electron flow produced by the reaction center chlorophyll pigments is used to pump H+ ions across the thylakoid membrane, setting up a proton-motive force a chemiosmotic potential used mainly in the production of ATP (stored chemical energy) or to reduce NADP+ to NADPH.
